title: FIFA World Cup US Bid 2018/2022 Custom Type
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090817225421im_/http:/typophile.com/files/WCU_BLOG_FINAL_6618.jpg)

I was really excited to see that one of the first projects I’ve gotten to work on while working at Pentagram has been posted on their [blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20090817225421/http:/pentagram.com/en/new/2009/08/preview-fifa-world-cup-us-bid.php). I’ve been designing this custom typeface under the creative direction of Michael Gericke and Luke Hayman.

It’s currently being used on [the GoUsaBid.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20090817225421/http:/www.gousabid.com/page/invite/trailer) site. I’ve been incredibly excited to see what the talented designers at Pentagram are doing with the typeface. Look forward to a future Pentagram blog post with all the applications of the bid message and ’Game’ typeface.

 [Read Between the Leading podcast](http://web.archive.org/web/20090817225421/http:/rbtl.us/) | [Pixelspread](http://web.archive.org/web/20090817225421/http:/pixelspread.com/) | [Pentagram](http://web.archive.org/web/20090817225421/http:/pentagram.com/)
author: mattmc

comments.content: As a currently slightly disappointed after yesterday’s result US Soccer fan, I saw the site posted on a soccer blog yesterday and checked it out briefly. Definitely a unique look, and good to see our national team becoming more design aware/focused ( [ussoccer.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20090817225421/http:/www.ussoccer.com/) was also just redesigned). Nice work, I’ll definitely be keeping an eye on the blog.
Are you the Pentagram intern I saw namedropping Michael Beirut and Paula Scher onstage during an improv comedy show?

Liked it.  
Any chances we can have a look at the complete character set?

You were actually really good. They constantly get people up there who have nothing interesting to say, so your material was great. And that font is great, BTW. Any change you can show us a complete character set?

Thanks James. I can’t post the full character set at the moment but there are a lot of printed materials being designed right now that use the typeface that should be out very soon. I’m sure they’ll be posted up on the GoUSAbid.com site.
